RautSoft.math.functions
Class Orthopoly

java.lang.Object
  RautSoft.math.functions.Orthopoly

public class Orthopoly
extends java.lang.Object

Polynomials - Orthogonal, Legendre

Example of Use


import static RautSoft.math.functions.Orthopoly.*;

public class OrthopolyEx {

    public static void main(String[] args) {



        System.out.println("Chebyshev Polynomials T(0,10.5)  = " + T(0,10.5));
        System.out.println("Chebyshev Polynomials T(1,10.5)  = " + T(1,10.5));
        System.out.println("Chebyshev Polynomials T(25,10.5) = " + T(25,10.5));

        System.out.println("Hermite Polynomials H(0,10.5)  = " + H(0,10.5));
        System.out.println("Hermite Polynomials H(1,10.5)  = " + H(1,10.5));
        System.out.println("Hermite Polynomials H(25,10.5) = " + H(25,10.5));


        System.out.println("Laguerre Polynomials L(0,10.5)  = " + L(0,10.5));
        System.out.println("Laguerre Polynomials L(1,10.5)  = " + L(1,10.5));
        System.out.println("Laguerre Polynomials L(25,10.5) = " + L(25,10.5));


        System.out.println("Legendre Polynomials P(0,10.5)  = " + P(0,10.5));
        System.out.println("Legendre Polynomials P(1,10.5)  = " + P(1,10.5));
        System.out.println("Legendre Polynomials P(25,10.5) = " + P(25,10.5));
        int n1=10;
        for (int i=1;i<= n1;i++){

            System.out.println("The chevyshev zeroes are : " + ChebyshevZeros(i, n1,10,100)  ) ;
        }

    }

}

Constructor Detail

Orthopoly

public Orthopoly()
Creates a new instance of Orthogonal Polynomials
  • T(n,x) Chebyshev polynomial of degree n evaluated at x
  • H(n,x) Hermite polynomial of degree n evaluated at x
  • T(n,x) chebyshev Laguerre polynomial nth generalized Laguerre polynomial with parameter a evaluated at x.

Method Detail

T

public static double T(int n,
                       double x)
Chebyshev polynomial T(n,x) It is generated recursively according to the formula: 
 Chebyshev polynomials satisfy the following recurrence relation:
 T(0,x) = 1,
 T(1,x) = x,
 H(n,x) = 2*x*T(n-1,x) - T(n-2,x, for n > 1.

These polynomials are orthogonal on the interval (-1, 1) with respect to the weight function w(x) = (1-x^2)^(-1/2).

Parameters:
x - evaluated at x, it is a double
n - degree of the polynomial, n= 0,1,...
Returns:
returns a double

ChebyshevZeros

ChebyshevZeros

public static double ChebyshevZeros(int k,
                                    int n)

H

public static double H(int n,
                       double x)
Hermite polynomials satisfy the following recurrence relation: 
 H(0,x) = 1,
 H(1,x) = 2*x,
 H(n,x) = 2*x*H(n-1,x) - 2*(n-1)*H(n-2,x), for n > 1.





Parameters:
x - evaluated at x, it is a double
n - degree of the polynomial, n= 0,1,...
Returns:
returns a double

L

public static double L(int n,
                       double a,
                       double x)
The L(n,x) function computes the nth generalized Laguerre polynomial with parameter a evaluated at x. 
 In the two argument case, L(n,x) computes the nth Laguerre polynomial which is equal to L(n,0,x).
     L(0,a,x) = 1
     L(1,a,x) = -x+1+a
     L(n,a,x) = (2*n+a-1-x)/n*L(n-1,a,x) - (n+a-1)/n*L(n-2,a,x),  for n > 1.

Parameters:
x - evaluated at x, it is a double
a - It is a rational number
n - degree of the polynomial, n= 0,1,...
Returns:
returns a double

L

public static double L(int n,
                       double x)

P

public static double P(int n,
                       double x)
Legendre polynomial P(n,x) It is generated recursively according to the formula: 
Legendre polynomials satisfy the following recurrence relation:
 P(0,x) = 1,
 P(1,x) = x,
 P(n,x) = (  (2*n-1) * ((2*n-2)* (2*n)*x) / (2*n*(n)*(2*n-2))
 P(n-1,x) - ((n-1)
 / n )* P(n-2,x)   )  for n> 1.
These polynomials are orthogonal on the interval [-1, 1] with respect to the weight function w(x) = 1.

Parameters:
x - evaluated at x, it is a double
n - degree of the polynomial, n= 0,1,...
Returns:
returns a double
